SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.planner

Class WeekDayPanelUI

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.planner.WeekDayPanelUI
public class WeekDayPanelUI extends Object
Represents UI of the schedule for one of the weekdays, displaying the name of the weekday, its schedule and a return button to the user.

Fields:
  • weekDay - a WeekDays enum representing the name of a specified weekdays
  • weekDayScrollPane - a JScrollPane contains a weekday panel created by createWeekDayPanel() providing a scrollable view for the user
  • tasks - a HashMap contains all tasks from one of the weekdays
  • mainCards - a JPanel with a CardLayout contains panels to be displayed to the user
  • main - a Main reference containing the passed instance of the main application class
Methods:
  • createWeekDayPanel() - creates a JPanel representing the UI schedule for the specified weekday, which is displayed to the user
Auxiliary methods:
  • createHeadlinePanel() - creates a JPanel containing the headline for the panel created by the createWeekDayPanel() method
  • createContentPanel() - creates a JPanel containing tasks panels for the panel created by the createWeekDayPanel() method
  • createTaskPanel(SingleTaskManager) - creates a JPanel representing the UI for a SingleTaskManager task
  • createBottomPanel() - creates a JPanel containing a JButton representing a return button
  • createGrid(int, int, String, int, Insets) - creates a GridBagConstraints used in the createTaskPanel(SingleTaskManager) method
Getters: weekDayScrollPane

  • Field Details

    • weekDay

      private final WeekDays weekDay
      Contains a WeekDays enum representing one of the weekdays. The weekDayScrollPane is created for the value of this enum.
      See Also:
      • WeekDayPanelUI(int, HashMap, JPanel, Main)
      • createHeadlinePanel()

    • weekDayScrollPane

      private final JScrollPane weekDayScrollPane
      Contains a JScrollPane that provides a scrollable view of the JPanel created by the createWeekDayPanel() method.
      See Also:
      • WeekDayPanelUI(int, HashMap, JPanel, Main)
      • getWeekDayScrollPane()

    • tasks

      private final HashMap<String,SingleTaskManager> tasks
      Contains all tasks from the schedule of a specified weekday. The key is a String representing the time of the task, and the value is a SingleTaskManager instance managing the task details.
      See Also:
      • WeekDayPanelUI(int, HashMap, JPanel, Main)
      • createWeekDayPanel()

    • mainCards

      private final JPanel mainCards
      Contains a JPanel which is provided as an argument to the constructor. This JPanel uses a CardLayout and contains panels to be displayed to the user.
      See Also:
      • WeekDayPanelUI(int, HashMap, JPanel, Main)
      • createBottomPanel()

    • main

      private final Main main
      Contains a Main instance provided as an argument to the constructor.
      See Also:
      • WeekDayPanelUI(int, HashMap, JPanel, Main)
      • createBottomPanel()

  • Constructor Details

    • WeekDayPanelUI

      public WeekDayPanelUI(int weekDayNum, HashMap<String,SingleTaskManager> tasks, JPanel mainCards, Main main)
      Constructs a new WeekDayPanelUI instance with the specified weekDayNum, tasks, mainCards, and main. This constructor initializes references to the weekDay, tasks, mainCards, and main fields based on the provided parameters. It also creates a weekDayScrollPane, sets its name and configures its vertical scroll bar policy.
      Parameters:
      weekDayNum - a number representing the weekday to initialize the WeekDays enum
      tasks - a HashMap used to initialize the tasks mapping
      mainCards - a JPanel used to initialize the mainCards container
      main - a Main instance used to initialize the main application context
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.createPlannerListener()

  • Method Details

    • createWeekDayPanel

      private JPanel createWeekDayPanel()
      Creates a JPanel representing the UI schedule for the specified weekday. This panel displays the name of the specified weekday, the schedule, and a return button to the user.
      Returns:
      a JPanel representing the UI schedule for the specified weekday
      See Also:
      • WeekDayPanelUI(int, HashMap, JPanel, Main)
      • createHeadlinePanel()
      • createContentPanel()
      • createBottomPanel()

    • createHeadlinePanel

      private JPanel createHeadlinePanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a customized JLabel with the Polish name of the weekDay. This method is used as an auxiliary method in the createWeekDayPanel() method, serving as a headline.
      Returns:
      a JPanel containing the headline for the panel created by the createWeekDayPanel() method

    • createContentPanel

      private JPanel createContentPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing individual JPanels for each task from the tasks field. This method is used as an auxiliary method in the createWeekDayPanel() method, serving as a schedule display.
      Returns:
      a JPanel containing the schedule for the panel created by the createWeekDayPanel() method
      See Also:
      • createTaskPanel(SingleTaskManager)

    • createTaskPanel

      private JPanel createTaskPanel(SingleTaskManager task)
      Creates a JPanel representing a task panel for the specified task. This method initializes and configures UI components such as labels and scrollable text area to display details of the task, including its name, priority, points scored, time, and description.
      Parameters:
      task - a SingleTaskManager object representing the task for which the panel is created
      Returns:
      a JPanel containing UI components displaying details of the specified task
      See Also:
      • createContentPanel()
      • createGrid(int, int, String, int, Insets)

    • createBottomPanel

      private JPanel createBottomPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JButton allowing the user to return to the main panel. This method initializes the return button and adds a listener to handle the return action. It is used as an auxiliary method in the createWeekDayPanel() method, serving as the bottom panel.
      Returns:
      a JPanel containing the return button

    • createGrid

      private GridBagConstraints createGrid(int gridx, int gridy, String gridwidth, int anchor, Insets instets)
      Creates and configures GridBagConstraints used within the createTaskPanel(SingleTaskManager) method to customize the layout of components within its containing JPanel.
      Parameters:
      gridx - the column position in the grid where the component should be placed
      gridy - the row position in the grid where the component should be placed
      gridwidth - the number of columns the component should span; can be null if not specified
      anchor - determines where, within the display area, to place the component if it doesn't fill the space
      instets - the external padding of the component; can be null if not specified
      Returns:
      a GridBagConstraints object configured for customizing the layout within the createTaskPanel(SingleTaskManager) method.

    • getWeekDayScrollPane

      public JScrollPane getWeekDayScrollPane()
      Returns:
      a weekDayScrollPane instance, which provides scrollable functionality for the weekday schedule panel
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.createPlannerListener()
